intro: Biscutella laevigata var. tirolensis, commonly known as the Alpine biscuitflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and its flowers are pale yellow to white, often appearing in clusters. This variety is noted for its compact growth and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
